Title: cypress_windswept
Content:
The Italian Cypress (Cupressus sempervirens) is a unique tree that can keep a tight, columnar shape. Despite its name, the tree ranges along the entire north coast of the Mediterranean. It has gray bark and grows larger than most cypresses, growing up to 60 feet (18.29 meters). Unlike other cypresses itâ€™s needles has no noticeable scent when crushed.

When the wind is particularly strong (like that on a mountain) the cypress grows in many particular shapes.
